intro: Wahlenbergia meyeri var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate lily-of-the-valley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens with proper care. The variety lanceolata is distinguished by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves compared to other varieties of Wahlenbergia.
